info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 5 at 5:36PM EDT until August 5 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington NC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast North Carolina, including the following county, New Hanover.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. Poor visibility and ponding on roadways could lead to hazardous travel during the evening rush hour.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 534 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wilmington, Wrightsville Beach, North Masonboro Island, Johnny Mercer Pier, South Masonboro Island, Figure Eight Island, University Of North Carolina At Wilmington, Windemere, Kings Grant, Seagate, Masonboro, Mayfaire, Wilmington International Airport, Landfall, Hightsville, Murrayville, Silver Lake, Ogden, Wrightsboro and Myrtle Grove. - weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING
